title: Generative Model-based Simulation of Driver Behavior when Using Control Input Interface for Teleoperated Driving in Unstructured Canyon Terrains. (arXiv:2305.09874v1 [cs.RO])
abstract: Unmanned ground vehicles (UGVs) in unstructured environments mostly operate through teleoperation. To enable stable teleoperated driving in unstructured environments, some research has suggested driver assistance and evaluation methods that involve user studies, which can be costly and require lots of time and effort. A simulation model-based approach has been proposed to complement the user study; however, the models on teleoperated driving do not account for unstructured environments. Our proposed solution involves simulation models of teleoperated driving for drivers that utilize a deep generative model. Initially, we build a teleoperated driving simulator to imitate unstructured environments based on previous research and collect driving data from drivers. Then, we design and implement the simulation models based on a conditional variational autoencoder (CVAE). Our evaluation results demonstrate that the proposed teleoperated driving model can generate data by simulating the driver

translated_abstract: 面对不规则环境中的无人地面车辆（UGVs），大多数需要通过远程操作实现稳定操纵。现有的基于用户研究的驾驶辅助和评估方法耗时费力，因此我们提出了一种基于仿真模型的新型解决方案，利用深度生成模型来生成准确的驾驶数据。我们建立了一个驾驶仿真器，收集了驾驶数据，并设计了一种基于条件变分自编码器（CVAE）的仿真模型。实验结果表明，该模型可通过模拟驾驶员行为来生成数据，提高驾驶操作的智能辅助和评估方法的效率。
tldr: 本研究提出一种基于仿真模型的新型解决方案，通过深度生成模型，并利用条件变分自编码器（CVAE）生成数据，提高驾驶操作的智能辅助和评估方法的效率。
en_tdlr: This study proposes a novel simulation model-based solution that utilizes deep generative models and a conditional variational autoencoder (CVAE) to generate accurate driving data, aimed at improving intelligent driver assistance and evaluation methods efficiency in teleoperated driving in unstructured canyon terrains.
